body_html:
note: Do not comment training code anywhere, because they might be used to reconstruct the graph.

Thats exactly the point that if we are trying to predict on a trained model then why do we need the training code at all?

Below line of code should take care of everything related to reconstructing the graph etc in case of predicting so that we need not to use any training code during prediction:
classifier = tf.estimator.Estimator(model_fn=model_fn, model_dir=MODEL_DIR)
body_text:
note: Do not comment training code anywhere, because they might be used to reconstruct the graph.


Thats exactly the point that if we are trying to predict on a trained model then why do we need the training code at all?
Below line of code should take care of everything related to reconstructing the graph etc in case of predicting so that we need not to use any training code during prediction:
classifier = tf.estimator.Estimator(model_fn=model_fn, model_dir=MODEL_DIR)
body:
>> note: Do not comment training code anywhere, because they might be used to reconstruct the graph.

Thats exactly the point that if we are trying to predict on a trained model then why do we need the training code at all?

Below line of code should take care of everything related to reconstructing the graph etc in case of predicting so that we need not to use any training code during prediction:
classifier = tf.estimator.Estimator(model_fn=model_fn, model_dir=MODEL_DIR)
